10.
In (b) , (c) and (d) above, the costs would in part
be dependent upon the number of participating stations.
Interconnection costs (b) would also be influenced greatly
by location of stations, (e.g., reaching San Francisco
would be important) and by present or future negotations
regarding AT&T tariffs for audio circuits. The program
and production expense would depend also on the number
of hours, complexity of presentation and the talent or
format involved.
In short, the cost variables are very great. Before
trying to present some cost data, it would be desirable
to determine how much receptivity there is to the basic
idea, what sort of limits for the financing might be
expected and whether the possibility exists of reduced
AT&T tariffs or alternate (satellite-Canadian or U.S.)
means of interconnection.
Toward the goal of determining the next steps, if any,
the planning group suggests that a meeting to discuss this
system be held by Fred Friendly of the Ford Foundation &
Frank Pace of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting in
mid-December.
